timeline.bodyText:
can queryCodeDir be null ?
Better to use isEmpty()
timeline.author: johanvos

timeline.message:
CAP cache improvements

Add `DontRunCAPQueryCode` native-image argument
Add `CAPQueryCodeDir` native-image argument
Split query code function and main
Better check for QueryCodeDir parameter

timeline.author: gradinac

replies.author: gradinac

timeline.bodyText: mx eclipseformat can sometimes bug up :) Put the comment above this line between /* and */ - I think that wouldn't cause it to break into 3 lines
timeline.author: gradinac

timeline.bodyText: We can also check if CAPQueryCodeDir is set here with Options.CAPQueryCodeDir.hasBeenSet()
timeline.author: gradinac
gradinac

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -861,7 +861,9 @@ private void setupNativeImage(String imageName, OptionValues options, Map<Method
 
                 if (!(NativeImageOptions.ExitAfterRelocatableImageWrite.getValue() && CAnnotationProcessorCache.Options.UseCAPCache.getValue())) {

timeline.bodyText: If you don't run the compiler driver because you exit after right QueryCode generation you should not even need to register the singleton. See https://github.com/oracle/graal/pull/2674/files#r464502705
timeline.author: olpaw

timeline.bodyText: I'd call this QueryCodeDir to better differentiate it from the regular CAP.... usecases (cached NativeCodeInfo result files).
timeline.author: olpaw
